chapter.title: Medications
chapter.para: Ledipasvir/sofosbuvir should not be used in patients with severe renal impairment (eGFR<30mL/min/1.73 m^2), with end-stage-renal disease, or on hemodialysis. Ledipasvir/sofosbuvir should not be used in combination with amiodarone, carbamazepine, oxcarbazepine, phenobarbital, phenytoin, rifabutin, rifampin, rifapentine, rosuvastatin, St. John’s wort, elvitegravir/cobicistat/emtricitabine/tenofovir, tipranavir/ritonavir, or simeprevir. Ledipasvir/sofosbuvir should not used in patients who require twice-daily proton pump inhibitor therapy for esophageal disease. Providers should check http://www.hep-druginteractions.org, https://www.hepatitis.va.gov/provider/guidelines/hcv-treatment-considerations.asp, and/or a pharmacist for additional drug interactions or contraindications before starting ledipasvir/sofosbuvir.

(VA 2017i) Chronic Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Infection: Treatment Considerations from the Department of Veterans Affairs National Hepatitis C Resource Center Program and the HIV, Hepatitis, and Related Conditions Program in the Office of Specialty Care Services link

row.entry: Routine tests in referrals for management of hepatitis C
topic: Precoordinated Expression T26958001 |Hepatic function panel (procedure)|
topic: Precoordinated Expression 440685005 |Calculation of international normalized ratio (procedure)|
topic: Precoordinated Expression 167181009 |Measurement of renal clearance of creatinine (procedure)|
The following lab is recommended if not performed within the previous 5 years.
topic: Precoordinated Expression 397662006 |Hepatitis C virus genotype determination (procedure)|
The following labs are recommended if not performed within the previous 10 years.
topic: Precoordinated Expression 47758006 |Hepatitis B surface antigen measurement (procedure)|
topic: Precoordinated Expression 59582004 |Hepatitis B core antibody measurement (procedure)|
topic: Precoordinated Expression 65911000 |Hepatitis B surface antibody measurement (procedure)|
topic: Precoordinated Expression 697001 |Hepatitis A virus antibody measurement (procedure)|
The following lab is recommended if not performed within the previous 6 months.
☐ HCV viral load (quantitative HCV RNA) 1 time (routine)
topic: Precoordinated Expression 395197008 |Hepatitis C viral load (procedure)|
The following lab is recommended if not performed within the previous 5 years.
topic: Precoordinated Expression 359796005 |Measurement of both Human immunodeficiency virus 1 antibody and Human immunodeficiency virus 2 antibody (procedure)|
The following lab is recommended if not performed within the previous 2 weeks.
topic: Precoordinated Expression 386558001 |Chorionic gonadotropin, beta-subunit measurement (procedure)|
This section should be available to users in gastroenterology settings and for primary care providers who are referring a patient to gastroenterology for management of hepatitis C

table.title: Terminology Versions
Terminology References

row.entry:
Display Text
If a code is used multiple times in the KNART, only the display text of the first instance is shown.

References
Count of the number of times the given code system and code pair is used in the KNART.

TSR-NoCode
TSR-NoCode is a placeholder indicating a code was requested, but was not provided.

[416118004 |Administration (procedure)] ->(260686004 |Method (attribute))->[129445006 |Administration - action (qualifier value)] ->(363701004 |Direct substance (attribute))->[Rx;312817 Ribavirin 200 MG Oral Capsule] ->(410675002 |Route of administration (attribute))->[260548002 |Oral (qualifier value)]

table.title: Group Organizational Behavior

row.entry: A group of related alternative actions is a sentence group if the item referenced by the action is the same in all the actions, and each action simply constitutes a different variation on how to specify the details for that item. For example, two actions that could be in a SentenceGroup are "aspirin, 500 mg, 2 times per day" and "aspirin, 300 mg, 3 times per day". In both cases, aspirin is the item referenced by the action, and the two actions represent two different options for how aspirin might be ordered for the patient. Note that a SentenceGroup would almost always have an associated selection behavior of "AtMostOne", unless it's a required action, in which case, it would be "ExactlyOne".
A group with this behavior logically groups its sub-elements, and may be shown as a visual group to the end user, but it is not required to do so.
Any group marked with this behavior should be displayed as a visual group to the end user.

table.title: Group Selection Behavior

row.entry: Any number of the items in the group may be chosen, from zero to all.
All the items in the group must be selected as a single unit.
All the items in the group are meant to be chosen as a single unit: either all must be selected by the end user, or none may be selected.
The end user must choose one and only one of the selectable items in the group. The user may not choose none of the items in the group.
The end user may choose zero or at most one of the items in the group.
The end user must choose a minimum of one, and as many additional as desired.

table.title: Required Behavior

row.entry: An action with this behavior must be included in the actions processed by the end user; the end user may not choose not to include this action.
An action with this behavior may be included in the set of actions processed by the end user.
An action with this behavior must be included in the set of actions processed by the end user, unless the end user provides documentation as to why the action was not included.

table.title: Precheck Behavior

row.entry: An action with this behavior is one of the most frequent actions that is, or should be, included by an end user, for the particular context in which the action occurs. The system displaying the action to the end user should consider "pre-checking" such an action as a convenience for the user.

An action with this behavior is one of the less frequent actions included by the end user, for the particular context in which the action occurs. The system displaying the actions to the end user would typically not "pre-check" such an action.

table.title: Cardinality Behavior

row.entry: An action with this behavior may only be completed once.
An action with this behavior may be repeated multiple times.

table.title: Item Flags

row.entry: This item, in a list entry, allows the user to enter a fill in value that is not present in the set of presented choices.

table.title: Read Only Behavior

row.entry: For a particular action or action group, specifies whether the elements are read only.

appendix.title: References
appendix.para: This appendix contains the list of related resources and supporting documents used in creating this KNART.
